title: US ambassador to Ukraine was removed because she stuck to the book
text:
Yovanovitch, 60, was unexpectedly removed from her post in capital Kyiv in May

Marie Yovanovitch to appear as part of House impeachment inquiry into Trump

The former US ambassador to Ukraine was removed from her post after she insisted Rudy Giuliani's requests for officials to join an investigation be relayed through official channels, a former diplomat has claimed.

The ambassador, Marie Yovanovitch, is scheduled to testify before congressional lawmakers on Friday as part of the House impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump.

Democrats expect her to appear despite the White House's position that no administration officials cooperate with the probe.

Marie Yovanovitch (pictured) was removed from her post after she insisted Rudy Giuliani's request to persuade officials to join the Biden investigation be relayed through official channels

Yovanovitch was recalled from Kyiv in May as Giuliani - who is Trump's personal attorney and has no official role in the US government - pushed Ukrainian officials to investigate baseless corruption allegations against ex-vice president Joe Biden and his son Hunter.

In a July 25 call, Mr Trump told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy that Yovanovitch was 'bad news,' according to a partial transcript released by the White House.

A former diplomat, recalling a recent conversation with Yovanovich, has now claimed she was removed after insisting that a request for Ukrainian officials to join in an investigation be relayed according to long-established protocol.

The source said Ms Yovanovitch refused to do 'all this offline, personal, informal stuff' and made clear that the US government had formal ways to request foreign governments' help with investigations.

The former diplomat insisted on anonymity to disclose the private conversation.
description: Marie Yovanovitch is scheduled to testify before congressional lawmakers on Friday as part of the House impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump.
